## Overview

This section contains all course exercises organized by topic and difficulty. Each exercise is designed to reinforce concepts from the corresponding chapters.

::: {.callout-tip}
## How to Use Exercises

1. **Read the instructions carefully** before starting
2. **Try solving independently first** before looking at hints
3. **Check your solution** against the provided solutions
4. **Review and reflect** on what you learned

:::

---

## Exercise Guidelines

::: {.panel-tabset}

## Difficulty Levels

- <span class="badge badge-success">Beginner</span>: Fundamental concepts, guided practice
- <span class="badge badge-warning">Intermediate</span>: Requires combining multiple concepts
- <span class="badge badge-danger">Advanced</span>: Complex problems, minimal guidance

## Time Estimates

Time estimates are provided for planning purposes:

- **Quick**: 15-30 minutes
- **Standard**: 30-60 minutes
- **Extended**: 1-2 hours
- **Project**: 2+ hours

## Submission

Submit completed exercises through:

- GitHub Pull Requests (preferred)
- Learning Management System
- Email (if specified)

## Getting Help

If you're stuck:

1. Review relevant chapter material
2. Check the hints provided
3. Discuss with peers in forums
4. Attend office hours
5. Contact the instructor

:::

## Tips for Success

::: {.callout-tip}
## Best Practices

1. **Start Early**: Don't wait until the deadline
2. **Read Thoroughly**: Understand requirements before coding
3. **Plan First**: Outline your approach before implementing
4. **Test Frequently**: Check your work as you go
5. **Document Well**: Comment your code clearly
6. **Ask Questions**: Don't struggle in silence
7. **Learn from Mistakes**: Review solutions even if you get it right
8. **Help Others**: Teaching reinforces your own learning

:::

---

## Common Mistakes

::: {.callout-warning}
## Avoid These Pitfalls

- **Skipping the instructions**: Read everything carefully
- **Not testing edge cases**: Test with various inputs
- **Poor time management**: Start early and pace yourself
- **Ignoring style guidelines**: Follow coding standards
- **Copying without understanding**: Make sure you understand the solution
- **Not asking for help**: Reach out when stuck

:::
